title: If I make a partial payment to loan company can they take my checking account number and withdraw the entire past due amount?
question: I wrote a letter to my loan company in February and told them I could not make payment because I don't have the money. I also informed them, i anticipate a job change that will enable me to resume payments and that I intended to make good on the loan.
answers: A creditor cannot levy your wages or your bank account unless they have already filed a lawsuit and obtained a judgment against you. Moreover, when they attempt to collect a debt, they need to follow the law. Our office is specialized in debt collection and bankruptcy law.
